roles.name: Environmental Scientist
roles.description: Conducts research and field studies on ecosystems, pollution, or climate impacts, informing policy and conservation.

meta.typicalBackground: Degree in environmental science, ecology, or related field, proficiency in lab/field techniques
challenges: Data gaps in remote or sensitive areas

sampleUseCase.scenario: A scientist collects water samples along a river impacted by industrial runoff, analyzing pollutant levels to recommend stricter discharge permits.

roles.name: Conservation Officer
roles.description: Implements measures to protect natural habitats and wildlife, enforcing environmental regulations and managing protected areas.

meta.typicalBackground: Background in wildlife management, forestry, or environmental policy, field-based enforcement experience
challenges: Illegal hunting/logging, human-wildlife conflicts, limited manpower across large territories

sampleUseCase.scenario: A conservation officer partners with local communities to establish a buffer zone around a nature reserve, offering alternative livelihood programs that reduce poaching.

roles.name: Climate Policy Analyst
roles.description: Examines climate data, models mitigation/adaptation strategies, and advises policymakers on emissions reduction and resilience planning.

meta.typicalBackground: Climate science or public policy degree, strong data interpretation and policy drafting skills
challenges: Complex interplay of global emission responsibilities

sampleUseCase.scenario: A policy analyst drafts a city-level climate action plan that sets a net-zero emissions target by 2040, incorporating renewable energy mandates and flood defense investments.

roles.name: Environmental Impact Assessor
roles.description: Evaluates proposed projects (infrastructure, industrial) for ecological and social consequences, recommending mitigation measures.

meta.typicalBackground: Expertise in environmental law, ecology, or engineering; recognized certification for EIA processes
challenges: Predicting long-term effects, ensuring enforceable follow-up

sampleUseCase.scenario: Before constructing a major highway, the assessor studies wildlife migration patterns, urging the inclusion of wildlife corridors and noise barriers to preserve local fauna.

roles.name: Sustainability Coordinator
roles.description: Implements and monitors sustainability initiatives within organizations, reducing waste, energy use, and carbon footprints.

meta.typicalBackground: Environmental or sustainability degree, project management, cross-departmental collaboration
challenges: Securing budget from management, measuring intangible benefits, changing staff behaviors

sampleUseCase.scenario: A coordinator launches a company-wide recycling and composting program, cutting landfill waste by 40% and saving disposal costs over the fiscal year.
